rev.desc.rev.desc: remove panel check.query
add variable $L.timeout.needed to enable/disable query timeout
modify the panel set.viewsearch to fix the joined table search issue
When modifying $L.file in Process cc.search.init, cc.gotoprob skips its query
Add a new parameter and pass the data of view define to implement the view search
Roll back the modifications of logical name solution, the logic is handled in RTE instead

Replace select panel by fselect function to get search colunms before doing select, this is for logical name solution purpose. RTE will decide if needs do cross-table query based on the search columns
panel patch.query

if qbe is not set and $L.incoming.sql is not null and inbox.query is null or incoming sql is not in inbox.query, set $L.incoming.sql to $L.sql to resovle confilication with Global search and other view function.
Panel: setup.search.go
set exit to: qbe
A different 'no records' message will be sent for searches against Incidents and Interactions now.
Added processing to start and patch.query panels to support expectedResolution date-type searches.
Recompile to fix broken parameter.
Added advanced find search parameters and subroutine.
On setup.search.go panel, modified $L.no.recs.msg to support enhanced messaging for SST mode.
Added logic in setup.search.go to clear secondary.assignment if the flag is set to primary.
updated as part of the cut through improvements so that if the query is invalid, it will exit from the select to the no.records panel. This allows it to exit more gracefully.
Updated for cut through. Will now use passed in query instead of building qbe query.
Modification made for DevTX ticket I0337.

In the panel named patch.query, modified the lines of code that manipulate the $pmc.open.after, $pmc.open.before, $pmc.close.after, and $pmc.close.before field so that the operator is >= or <= in ESS mode, but > or < in non-ESS mode. This is because the way things are worded. In ESS, the wording on the ess.SM.search format prompts for a date that is BETWEEN two date. In non-ESS, the wording in cc.search.service.g prompts for a date that is AFTER or BEFORE a given date.
panel: patch.query
removed the following expressions:
$pmc.open.after=val($pmc.open.after, 3);$pmc.open.before=val($pmc.open.before, 3)
$pmc.update.after=val($pmc.update.after, 3);$pmc.update.before=val($pmc.update.before, 3)
$pmc.close.after=val($pmc.close.after, 3);$pmc.close.before=val($pmc.close.before, 3)
Add the append query after the genquery panel.
Making either assignment queries work.

descript.descript: remove panel check.query
add variable $L.timeout.needed to enable/disable query timeout
modify the panel set.viewsearch to fix the joined table search issue
When modifying $L.file in Process cc.search.init, cc.gotoprob skips its query
Add a new parameter and pass the data of view define to implement the view search
Roll back the modifications of logical name solution, the logic is handled in RTE instead

Replace select panel by fselect function to get search colunms before doing select, this is for logical name solution purpose. RTE will decide if needs do cross-table query based on the search columns
panel patch.query
appending $L.incoming.sql to $L.sql if inbox query is null and $L.incoming.sql is not null to resovle confilication with Global search function.
Panel: setup.search.go
set exit to: qbe
A different 'no records' message will be sent for searches against Incidents and Interactions now.
Added processing to start and patch.query panels to support expectedResolution date-type searches.
Recompile to fix broken parameter.
Added advanced find search parameters and subroutine.
On setup.search.go panel, modified $L.no.recs.msg to support enhanced messaging for SST mode.
Added logic in setup.search.go to clear secondary.assignment if the flag is set to primary.
updated as part of the cut through improvements so that if the query is invalid, it will exit from the select to the no.records panel. This allows it to exit more gracefully.
Updated for cut through. Will now use passed in query instead of building qbe query.
Modification made for DevTX ticket I0337.

In the panel named patch.query, modified the lines of code that manipulate the $pmc.open.after, $pmc.open.before, $pmc.close.after, and $pmc.close.before field so that the operator is >= or <= in ESS mode, but > or < in non-ESS mode. This is because the way things are worded. In ESS, the wording on the ess.SM.search format prompts for a date that is BETWEEN two date. In non-ESS, the wording in cc.search.service.g prompts for a date that is AFTER or BEFORE a given date.
panel: patch.query
removed the following expressions:
$pmc.open.after=val($pmc.open.after, 3);$pmc.open.before=val($pmc.open.before, 3)
$pmc.update.after=val($pmc.update.after, 3);$pmc.update.before=val($pmc.update.before, 3)
$pmc.close.after=val($pmc.close.after, 3);$pmc.close.before=val($pmc.close.before, 3)
Add the append query after the genquery panel.
Making either assignment queries work
